intro: Olmediophaena coriacea, commonly known as the rough-hairy dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. The plant prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in grasslands and disturbed areas. Its fibrous roots and robust stems allow it to thrive in arid conditions. Olmediophaena coriacea is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat various ailments.
